title: @Riot It's funny how fast you come up with these support changes
body:
No resource is enough to give roles more impact and "meaningful" choices without  breaking a sweat as long as it is not toplane. 

At this point you are literally just playing with us, aren't you? 
No keystone, no tp buffs, no small gold cost adjustment to help toplaners impact the game earlier, no jungle nerfs, no nerfs to botlane powercurves.
There are so many small things you could immediately do to help making toplane more impactful aaand you stay silent and go over to work on support role. 


Atleast challengers can now duoQ so that the entire top 10 highest challenger only consist of adc and support player. I don't know RIOT what you are trying to do or what your goals are. So much about more transparency you promised after the DynQ disaster. Are you still atleast THINKING about making toplane more impactful and help fighters in particular? Or is it another "we  rework fighters" in hopes that we just shut up and stop complaining because EVENTUALLY something might maybe happen sometime in the future in another dimension or parallel universe? 

Since i don't want to be a pesky board troll i also have a suggestion for another Login Screen:

Images of Jax, Irelia, Aatrox with a chain collar around their neck with foam coming out of their mouths and a red circle with a red line through their faces subtitled: "Must stay out!"
floating above an image of Toplane.



Edit: Because i already saw that: Could u guys please not randomly upvote or downvote people for differing opinions? Can we please stop with this shit? 
Thank you.

I'm gonna play devil's advocate here and ask how else they should view supports? If you stop making them as item-focused and make them more solo-skilled champions with their *kits* then we traditionally see them dominate solo lanes by themselves. It's very tough to design a support with a strong kit that doesn't go off and dominate by in a solo lane for the higher income. 

Supports have to operate on a lower income, and so if they have a successfully strong solo-skilled kit on low income, we see them be naturally better than solo laners that are balanced around having a solo-lane income.

We saw Tahm dominate jungle/top lane for awhile, Lulu is another great example as well.

Genuinely curious as to your thoughts about this though.

I like this idea, but I also don't know how it could be implemented into the game. There's only so many items they can create that influence the game like Redemption does, and I'd be extremely worried about creating any items that other classes can abuse.

We see the same problem with support items that we see with supports themselves. They're gated by costs. To create influential items for supports, they naturally have to be less expensive.

If the stats/rewards are too high while the item is at support-level cost, other classes will abuse it.
If the stats/rewards are too low as a support-level cost, it's a poor item that wont be built
If the stats/rewards are good but cost is too high, you've just made another solo-lane item
If stats/rewards are good and price too low, it'll be another "must have" item that dominates the game

Supports in general are just extremely difficult to balance because they function on such a low income. That's probably *why* they've been shoved into the item stackstick corner, because that's just (believe it or not) the least difficult/problematic approach they have.

Basically: 
you can't balance supports around they're kits because they'll turn into solo-lane monsters.
you can't provide a wide array of viable supports with items because they'll be abused by other classes

It's a bitch of a problem

Also, whoever is just downvoting me/upvoting Mr. Unicorn could really provide they're own perspective or really anything to this discussion. No one likes a voting-bot that functions purely on whichever comment sounds good or most closely resembles they're predisposed opinions.

All i want to prevent is another ardent meta in the end a nerf to marksmen to open up the support role. Imo one reason why noone plays it is because they ARE dependent on their adc and while it will never be completely independent of each other right now it's more a life and death situation.

I really wouldn't say things like Locket or Redemption are "abused" so to speak. They're definitely viable for other classes, but not 100% the most efficient in most situations. I honestly can't think of any cases of support items being abused, but there are several examples outside of the support class where items have been abused. Black Cleaver, pretty much all Lethality items, etc. So while we don't really have any good examples for support items to this date, I wouldn't necessarily say it isn't possible. It's just something to be careful of if/when we do see a support item rehaul, as I do think cases of item abusement is a real threat with this approach.

Although, this is definitely an avenue of balance that I would like to see explored. Like I said before, I was just playing the devil's advocate because I honestly didn't know where the conversation would go.

Overall, I think we can conclude that your idea is at least worth exploring. It brings a different set of risks then the current method of reducing supports to adc stat-sticks, but the potential reward could also be much more enjoyable than currently.

small question...
What was the DynQ disaster?

Since people leave out half what actually happened: 
Riot promised a pure soloQ we have been asking for  ages 2 weeks after the release of DynQ to see if DynQ actually works and such.

Welp for a few months complete silence on the topic hundreds over hundreds of posts ignored and no soloQ in sight. DynQ was the biggest upfuck you can imagine: silver players boosted to diamond and master. Entire LCS teams playing together against random soloQ challenger. 

Then after nearly half a year the first reaction which kinda read like: There is definitely a world where soloQ might not return. 
Boom radio silence. 

Then they come up with how great DynQ is right now. Dia+ is solo/duo only (after damage has been done) and the rest is working as intented, everyone who is now complaining is just a "very very small but passionate minority" but "we are past the point of talking about dynamicQ". 

Way too many people still confuse DynQ with role selection which got introduced WITH the new dynamicQ. 

After the year riot basically said "oops we fucked up sorry haHAA more transparency btw". 
That was it basically. Mocked us with the direct quotes i gave there, shoved it down our throat, lied and ignored us and acted like "we know you dont like dynQ but we know better what you actually want". 
I believe riot today still thinks DynQ was a great thing.

Start of season 6:

Riot removed Solo queue and made it possible for teams of premades up to FIVE to queue up together for ranked and if you got unlucky you would get matched against 5 premades while your team consisted of 2 premades and 3 solos or being solo get matched with 4 premade teammates (very high possibility to get flamed or forced into one role). Which without much thinking is clear that it would bring problems.

In season 7 they finally removed Dynamic Queue and brought back solo queue and additionally Flex Q which is practically Dynamic queue just with the restriction that you can't queue up as a 4 premade group.

*5 seasons of barely touched Sightstone, 4 seasons of gold gens, 2 seasons of "Eye" lines, 1 season of quests*
